data.title: Update IOSNet.java
data.body: Can not open url in brower

data.title: libgdx moe backends  can not open url!
data.body:
In https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-moe/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/iosmoe/IOSNet.java

line 66. 
```
return uiApp.openURL(NSURL.fileURLWithPath(URI));
```

should be
```
return  uiApp.openURL(NSURL.URLWithString(URI));
```

data.title: HTML/GWT only loading the 'badlogic.jpg' image
data.body:
I'm fairly new to libgdx, so I could have simply missed something, but for some reason, the only asset I can load when running a html project is the default 'badlogic.jpg' image. 
I just downloaded the most recent setup jar, generated the project (I used tools and Box2d plugins), and imported the gradle project into intellij and did the other steps needed to start a desktop application, which works great. 
This happens regardless if I have the android configuration checked. Even if I rename the file in the assets folder, it still loads on the webpage. But the really weird part is that if I delete every badlogic.jpg image in my entire project and restarting my ide and html server, it still loads on the webpage. My only guess it that something isn't updating, but I can't find what or how to fix it. 
For example, if I try to load 'badlogics.jpg' (only by adding a 's' to the 'img = new Texture("badlogic.jpg");' in the default code), the webpage spits out 
"GwtApplication: exception: Couldn't load image 'badlogics.jpg',file does not exist
Couldn't load image 'badlogics.jpg', file does not exist"
even if it really does exist in the assets folder.
I have started the html project within the terminal with 'gradlew html:superDev' and with by ide and gradle by adding it as a run configuration, the setting for that are as follows 
Gradle project: Game:html 
Tasks: html:superDev

I am on Windows 10, if that helps.

data.title: Tiled map tiles objects support
data.body:
Tiled tiles collision objects support request
http://doc.mapeditor.org/reference/tmx-changelog/#tiled-010 
LibGDX 1.9.5

*.tmx file fragment sample with emded tileset based on image collestion:
```
<tileset>
  <tile id="14">
   <image/>
   <objectgroup draworder="index">
    <object id="1" x="0" y="0" width="256" height="210"/>  <!--rectangle-->
   </objectgroup>
  </tile>
</tileset>
```

*.tsx file fragment sample to tilemap with tileset in source based on tileset image:
```
<tileset>
 <image source="..."/>
 <tile id="34">
  <objectgroup draworder="index">
   <object id="1" x="25" y="34" width="102" height="26"/> <!--rectangle-->
   <object id="2" x="35" y="105" width="95" height="27">
    <ellipse/>
   </object>
   <object id="3" x="146" y="165">
    <polygon points="37,-42 58,-41 82,35 -35,35 -65,0 9,-39 49,-83"/>
   </object>
   <object id="4" x="53" y="19">
    <polyline points="0,0 44,25 -13,71 49,103 -15,141 -8,192"/>
   </object>
  </objectgroup>
 </tile>
</tileset>
```
As I can see, need to update com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TmxMapLoader#loadTileSet method 
Object parsing exist in com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.BaseTmxMapLoader#loadObject method

data.title: Added a lint file to to prevent ununnecessary error markings
data.body:
Added a lint file to make IntelliJ / Android Studio stop doing Android validation on the desktop Java project (to prevent ununnecessary error markings).

Original forum topic with problem described:
http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=24943

Source of solution (see the comment of Róbert Papp):
https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-122904

data.title: Fix being unable to compile for gwt

data.body:
Add setGL20 and setGL30 methods to the Graphics interface.
Fix GLES 3.0 support methods on ios

data.title: get(String name) for hex Strings
data.body:
If get(String name) is now called with a hex String of 6 or 8 characters, a new Color with specified RGB(A) channel values is returned.
For Example get("ff000088") will return a red color with transparancy.

With this change it is possible to use custom colors when printing text. Also the custom Color may have transparancy

data.title: Fix #4536: HexagonalTiledMapRenderer staggering bug
data.body: Fixed staggering on even indexes for HexagonalTiledMapRenderer (now the map has the same staggering as it appears in Tiled Editor)

data.title: HexagonalTiledMapRenderer staggering bug
data.body:
I have found a issue with the staggering index on the HexagonalTiledMapRenderer. When loading a map from Tiled Editor the staggering index would be odd if the selected option from tiled would be even, and vice versa.

#### Reproduction steps/code
A loaded hexagonal tiled map will not look the same as the map exported from Tiled.

data.title: Bullet wrapper - Serialization support
data.body:
Hello, 
I use the libgdx bullet wrapper. Which works great.

My process looks like that. I get meshes from vtk, convert them to trianglemeshshapes and then to bvh.
I would like to somehow serialize my BVHs (when possible also the trianglemeshshapes ) since it's creation is sometimes a long process. I saw that there is a btDefaultSerializer in bullet to serialize them.

Would it be possible to **wrap** the **btDefaultSerializer**?

This would be great.
Thanks and keep up the great work.

data.title: #4532 AL_DIRECT_CHANNELS_SOFT fixes narrow stereo channel problem wit…
data.body:
Fix to this:
- https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/4532

It is not really possible to test this without listening to the difference. The difference is that without this fix, the left and right channels won't be cleanly separated and the audio sounds muffled. With this fix, there should be cleaner separation between left and right channels.

data.title: [Bug] Gdx.input.isKey(Just)Pressed(Keys.BACKSLASH), doesn't seem to work on Linux Mint 18 KDE Edition
Narrow stereo field in LWJGL3 backend
data.body:
#### Issue details
LWJGL3 backend has noticeably narrower stereo field. Quick googling shows that it is probably regression of this:
http://townsgame.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=13&t=10302 and  https://code.google.com/archive/p/libgdx/issues/1374

#### Reproduction steps/code
You need a stereo sample that is panned to left, middle and right. You can easily check the difference by playing the sample in any player and with lwjgl3 and lwjgl2 backends. Player and lwjgl2 play full stereo field where as lwjgl3 sound is muffled.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5 snapshot and LWJGL3 backend

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [x] MacOS

Tested on windows and MacOS

data.title: Vastly improve performance of DefaultShader#canRender(..)
data.body:
Explanation:
`DefaultShader#canRender(..)` used to call `combineAttributes(..)` on the renderable, and then only use the mask.  `combineAttributes(..)` is very expensive (around O(n<sup>2</sup>log(n)) where n is the number of unique attributes, because it sorts after adding each attribute).  But all the function really needs is the combined mask, and since we keep the masks for both Attributes objects around anyway we can get it with just a bitwise or.

Our game uses a large number of ModelInstances with about 15 shaders, which meant every time it added a renderable to the batch (several times per ModelInstance) it would have to iterate ~7 shaders on average and combineAttributes(..) for each one, which was a major hit to pre-render time.  Implementing this change brought the frame render time on our min spec phone from 40ms to 30ms, a major performance gain that made the game playable.

data.title: Add Mesh constructor for VertexAttributes
data.body:
I was finding it kind of hacky to work around this missing constructor. I wanted to work with a VertexAttributes object to calculate some stuff before instantiating the Mesh, so I ended up creating one and throwing it away before passing the same individual VertexAttribute objects to Mesh for it to generate another VertexAttributes.

Also, I could see someone possibly wanting to subclass VertexAttributes.

data.title: limiting fps on lwjgl3 to prevent cpu hog/overheat on OSX
data.body:
#### Issue details
LWJGL3 will cause cpu/gpu overheat due to no limitations on FPS
This is more likely on macbooks with intel iris chipsets and some other macs

#### Reproduction steps/code
Is it possible to implement something like:
http://forum.lwjgl.org/index.php?topic=5653.0

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
latest libgdx as of this comment

data.title: Gradle Repo is Broken
data.body:
Version 1.9.5 repo is broken. It was working fine yesterday but this morning I get the following error

```
Exception in thread "main" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't load shared library 'gdx64.dll' for target: Windows 10, 64-bit
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.load(SharedLibraryLoader.java:119)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxNativesLoader.load(GdxNativesLoader.java:33)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglNativesLoader.load(LwjglNativesLoader.java:47)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.<init>(LwjglApplication.java:81)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.<init>(LwjglApplication.java:69)
	at com.charlatano.overlay.Overlay.open(Overlay.kt:57)
	at com.charlatano.Charlatano.main(Charlatano.kt:56)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:147)
Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Unable to read file for extraction: gdx64.dll
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.readFile(SharedLibraryLoader.java:127)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.loadFile(SharedLibraryLoader.java:280)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.load(SharedLibraryLoader.java:115)
	... 11 more
```

Here's my build script.

```groovy
buildscript {
    ext.kotlin_version = "1.1-M04"
    ext.gdxVersion = "1.9.5"

    repositories {
        mavenCentral()
    }

    dependencies {
        classpath "org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-gradle-plugin:$kotlin_version"
    }
}

apply plugin: "java"
apply plugin: "kotlin"
apply plugin: "application"

sourceCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_1_8

repositories {
    mavenCentral()
}
dependencies {
    compile group: "com.badlogicgames.gdx", name: "gdx", version: gdxVersion
    compile group: "com.badlogicgames.gdx", name: "gdx-box2d", version: gdxVersion
    compile group: "com.badlogicgames.gdx", name: "gdx-backend-lwjgl", version: gdxVersion

    compile group: "com.badlogicgames.gdx", name: "gdx-platform", version: "$gdxVersion:natives-desktop"
    compile group: "com.badlogicgames.gdx", name: "gdx-freetype-platform", version: "$gdxVersion:natives-desktop"
}
```
